issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The path used for S3 images is incorrect:

{code}
/services/objectstorage/services/objectstorage/
{code}

The service path "/services/objectstorage/" is repeated but should only occur once.

comments.body: Should be a quick fix. Removing the service path prepend in DownloadManifestFactory.

Internal commit: ec97ebd76253121c43bab151b735728410d1a5b2
Eucalyptus commit: 3afbfa17ccd765e8aebb27bd621375a5e208ab22

Removes the /services/objectstorage static prefix on buckets for the download manifest url signing as that is handled correctly without it now.

It was actually working because of a bug in the REST bindings for the OSG that was removing all instances of the service path, not just the first. That has been fixed as well.

To test: run instance and watch the logs on the NC to verify that the url has only one /services/objectstorage path element.
